Package org.microbean.type

Class JavaType

java.lang.Object
org.microbean.type.Type<Type>
org.microbean.type.JavaType
Direct Known Subclasses:
CdiType
@Experimental public class JavaType extends Type<Type>
A Type that models a java.lang.reflect.Type for use primarily by a Type.Semantics instance.
Author:
Laird Nelson
See Also:
  • Type.Semantics

      NullPointerException - if type is null

  • Method Details

    • named

      public boolean named()
      Returns true if and only if this JavaType represents a Java type that has a name.

      In the Java reflective type system, only Class and TypeVariable instances have names.

      Overrides:
      named in class Type<Type>
      Returns:
      true if and only if this JavaType represents a Java type that has a name
      See Also:
      • name()
      • Class.getName()
      • TypeVariable.getName()
      Idempotency:
      This method is, and its overrides must be, idempotent and deterministic.
      Thread Safety:
      This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

    • name

      public String name()
      Returns the name of this JavaType if it has one or null if it does not.

      Only classes and type variables in the Java reflective type system have names.

      Specified by:
      name in class Type<Type>
      Returns:
      the name of this JavaType, or null
      Idempotency:
      This method is, and its overrides must be, idempotent and deterministic.
      Nullability:
      This method and its overrides may, and often will, return null.
      Thread Safety:
      This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

    • represents

      public boolean represents(Type<?> type)
      Returns true if this JavaType represents the same type as that represented by the supplied Type.

      Type representation is not the same thing as equality. Specifically, a Type may represent another Type exactly, but may not be equal to it.

      Equality is subordinate to type representation. That is, in determining whether a given Type represents another Type, their equals(Object) methods may be called, but a Type's equals(Object) method must not call Type.represents(org.microbean.type.Type).

      Overrides:
      represents in class Type<Type>
      Parameters:
      type - the Type to test; may be null in which case false will be returned
      Returns:
      true if this Type represents the same type as that represented by the supplied Type
      Idempotency:
      This method is, and its overrides must be, idempotent and deterministic.
      Thread Safety:
      This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

    • top

      public final boolean top()
      Returns true if and only if the return value of Type.object() is identical to Object.class.

    • box

      public JavaType box()
      If this JavaType represents a primitive type, and if and only if boxing was enabled in the constructor, returns a JavaType representing the corresponding "wrapper type", or this JavaType itself in all other cases.
      Specified by:
      box in class Type<Type>
      Returns:
      a JavaType representing the corresponding "wrapper type" where appropriate, or this
      See Also:
      • Type.box()
      Idempotency:

      Nullability:
      This method does not, and its overrides must not, return null.
      Thread Safety:
      This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

    • directSupertypes

      public Collection<JavaType> directSupertypes()
      Returns an unmodifiable and immutable Collection of the direct supertypes of this JavaType, or an empty Collection if there are no direct supertypes.

      This implementation uses the JavaTypes.directSupertypes(Type) method.

      Specified by:
      directSupertypes in class Type<Type>
      Returns:
      an unmodifiable and immutable Collection of the direct supertypes of this JavaType; never null
      Idempotency:
      This method is, and its overrides must be, idempotent and deterministic.
      Nullability:
      This method does not, and its overrides must not, return null.
      Thread Safety:
      This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

    • type

      public JavaType type()
      If this JavaType represents a ParameterizedType or a GenericArrayType returns a JavaType representing its raw type or generic component type, or, if this JavaType does not represent a ParameterizedType or a GenericArrayType, returns this.
      Specified by:
      type in class Type<Type>
      Returns:
      a suitable JavaType; never null; often this
      Idempotency:
      This method is, and its overrides must be, idempotent and deterministic.
      Nullability:
      This method does not, and its overrides must not, return null.
      Thread Safety:
      This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

    • hasTypeParameters

      public boolean hasTypeParameters()
      Returns true if and only if this JavaType represents a generic Class by virtue of having type parameters.

      This implementation checks to see if the return value of Type.object() is an instance of Class and, if so, if that Class has any type parameters.

      Overrides:
      hasTypeParameters in class Type<Type>
      Returns:
      true if and only if this Type represents a generic class by virtue of having type parameters
      See Also:
      • Type.object()
      • typeParameters()

    • hasTypeArguments

      public boolean hasTypeArguments()
      Returns true if and only if this Type represents a ParameterizedType by virtue of having type arguments.

      This implementation checks to see if the return value of Type.object() is a ParameterizedType.

      Overrides:
      hasTypeArguments in class Type<Type>
      Returns:
      true if and only if this Type represents a parameterized type by virtue of having type arguments
      See Also:
      • Type.object()
      • typeArguments()

    • typeArguments

      public List<JavaType> typeArguments()
      Returns an unmodifiable List of this JavaType's type arguments.

      The returned List will be non-empty if and only if this JavaType models a ParameterizedType.

      Specified by:
      typeArguments in class Type<Type>
      Returns:
      an unmodifiable List of this JavaType's type arguments; never null

      Thread Safety:

    • componentType

      public JavaType componentType()
      Returns the component type of this JavaType, if there is one, or null if there is not.

      This method returns a non-null result only when this JavaType represents a Type that is either an array or a GenericArrayType.

      Specified by:
      componentType in class Type<Type>
      Returns:
      the component type of this JavaType, if there is one, or null if there is not

    • lowerBounded

      public boolean lowerBounded()
      Returns true if and only if this Type represents a WildcardType with a lower bound.

      This implementation checks to see if the return value of Type.object() is a WildcardType, and, if so, if that WildcardType has a lower bound.

      Overrides:
      lowerBounded in class Type<Type>
      Returns:
      true if and only if this JavaType represents a WildcardType with a lower bound
      See Also:

      Thread Safety:
      This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

    • lowerBounds

      public List<JavaType> lowerBounds()
      Returns an unmodifiable List of this JavaType's lower bounds.

      The returned List will be non-empty if and only if this Type models a WildcardType with a lower bound.

      The returned List will contain at most one element.

      Specified by:
      lowerBounds in class Type<Type>
      Returns:
      an unmodifiable List of this JavaType's lower bounds; never null; often empty
      See Also:
      • WildcardType.getLowerBounds()
      Idempotency:
      This method is, and its overrides must be, idempotent and deterministic.
      Nullability:
      This method does not, and its overrides must not, return null.
      Thread Safety:
      This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

    • upperBounds

      public List<JavaType> upperBounds()
      Returns an unmodifiable List of this JavaType's upper bounds.

      The returned List will be non-empty if and only if this Type models either a WildcardType or a TypeVariable.

      The returned List will contain at most one element.

      Specified by:
      upperBounds in class Type<Type>
      Returns:

    • of

      public static JavaType of(JavaType.Token<?> type)
      Creates a new JavaType without autoboxing.
      Parameters:
      type - a JavaType.Token representing the type to model; must not be null
      Returns:
      a new JavaType; never null
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if type is null.
      See Also:
      • of(Type, boolean)
      Idempotency:
      This method is idempotent but not deterministic (in that it returns a new JavaType with each invocation). However, any JavaType returned from this method is guaranteed to equal any other JavaType returned from this method, provided the inputs to all invocations are equal.
      Nullability:
      This method never returns null.
      Thread Safety:
      This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
